home.first_section_text_1: Hello there! welcome to my little space in the web, here I showcase my works, experiments and projects related to web development. Right now am experiencing with animations and transitions effects to create a more profound experience.
home.first_section_text_2: I am a software engineer based in Medellín, Colombia, driven by a constant passion for creation and improvement. I am enthusiastic about technology and always eager to embrace new challenges and opportunities to learn and grow.
home.second_section_text_1: I have been working as a Software Engineer with expertise in React, NextJS, and TypeScript, at Globant and now at Gorilla Logic, contributing to large-scale web applications with a strong focus on microfrontend architecture.
home.second_section_text_2: I've led the migration of legacy systems, removing deprecated technologies, and implemented accessibility standards (WCAG AA/AAA) and RTL support for internationalization. I also collaborated using AI-assisted workflows with Cursor to iterate on component design and improve development efficiency.

about.about_description: Juan Pablo Jiménez, frontend developer, with expertise in TypeScript, Next.js, and React, constantly exploring new tools, CMS platforms, and best practices to stay ahead in front-end development. For me, learning is not just a necessity—it's a passion that drives me to create innovative, efficient, and positive impactful digital experiences.
about.about_me: I'm Juan Pablo Jiménez, frontend developer passionate about blending technical precision with artistic creativity. I graduated in Systems and Computer Engineering from UPB in Medellín, Colombia, where I learned that software development is not only technical but also an art.
about.about_me_2: My interests include coding, problem-solving, visual design, music, and content creation. I enjoy transforming ideas into real-world solutions, ensuring each project follows agile methodologies, iterative improvements, open communication, and clean architectural practices.
about.about_me_3: Over the last few years I've had the opportunity to work on impactful frontend projects, driving the modernization of enterprise web platforms. I contributed to the migration of legacy systems by replacing outdated technologies with scalable solutions using React and NextJS. Working with microfrontend architectures, I integrated complex modules while ensuring maintainability and performance.
about.about_me_4: I've implemented internationalization features including Right-to-Left support and adhered to high accessibility standards (WCAG AA/AAA). Through AI-assisted workflows with Cursor, I enhanced collaboration and iteration speed across teams. These experiences have sharpened my problem-solving skills and deepened my passion for building inclusive, high-quality web applications.
about.skills: I specialize in TypeScript, Next.js, and React, constantly exploring new tools, CMS platforms, and best practices to stay ahead in front-end development. For me, learning is not just a necessity—it's a passion that drives me to create innovative, efficient, and positive impactful digital experiences.

contact.contact_description: Get in touch with Juan Pablo Jiménez, frontend developer from Medellín, Colombia. Available for projects and collaborations.
contact.ready_to_bring_your_ideas_to_life: Ready to bring ideas to life? I'm always excited to work and collaborate in new projects.
contact.available_for_remote_work_worldwide: Open to new opportunities and exciting projects of impact.

projects.description_rq_1: Random-Q is a dynamic web application designed to spark engaging conversations through a diverse collection of thought-provoking questions. Whether you're looking to deepen connections on a date, liven up social gatherings, or simply explore intriguing topics, Random-Q provides the perfect conversation starter for every occasion.
projects.description_rq_2: Thoughtfully Categorized Questions: Random-Q organizes its questions into distinct categories, catering to a variety of interests and social contexts: Philosophical inquiries for deep, reflective discussions. Spicy ice-breakers to add a playful twist to any interaction. Nerdy and geek-inspired prompts for pop culture enthusiasts and trivia lovers. Curious and offbeat queries to ignite creativity and curiosity.
projects.description_rq_3: The app features a carefully curated selection of bilingual (Spanish and English) questions, ensuring inclusivity and accessibility for a wider audience. Each question is enriched with intuitive design elements, including category-specific icons, color-coded tags, and an intensity slider that allows users to filter questions based on their comfort level or mood.
projects.impact_rq: Random-Q is more than just a question generator—it's a tool for connection. By blending thoughtful design, intuitive functionality, and a diverse range of topics, the app empowers users to break the ice, reflect deeply, and engage meaningfully in any social setting. Its bilingual support and customizable features make it a versatile companion for individuals and groups alike, fostering curiosity and dialogue across cultures and contexts.
projects.tech_highlight_rq_1: Next.js Framework: Leveraged for its server-side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG) capabilities, ensuring optimal performance and SEO optimization.
projects.tech_highlight_rq_2: Firebase Firestore: Used as the backend database to manage the like system and store question data efficiently.
projects.tech_highlight_rq_3: Firebase Hosting: Deployed the app with Firebase's robust hosting solution, ensuring fast load times and scalability.
projects.tech_highlight_rq_4: CI/CD Pipeline: Automated workflows via GitHub Actions streamline the development and deployment process, enabling rapid iteration and consistent delivery.

fullstack_course.title: Fullstack Development Course
fullstack_course.subtitle: Learn by Contributing
fullstack_course.description: Welcome to the Fullstack Development Course section! This is a special space created for students to learn Git, GitHub, and open-source contribution workflows by making real contributions to this portfolio website.
fullstack_course.goal_description: The main objective is to provide students with hands-on experience in version control, collaborative development, and open-source contribution practices. Students will learn how to fork repositories, create branches, make meaningful commits, and submit pull requests.
fullstack_course.step_1: 1. Fork the portfolio repository to your GitHub account (Repo link here)
fullstack_course.step_2: 2. Clone your forked repository to your local machine
fullstack_course.step_3: 3. Create a new branch: git checkout -b add-student-[your-name]
fullstack_course.step_4: 4. Copy src/constants/students/juan-pablo-jimenez.ts to your-username.ts and edit it with your information
fullstack_course.step_6: 6. Add your profile image to your folder
fullstack_course.step_7: 7. Make sure you have Node.js installed on your system
fullstack_course.step_8: 8. Install pnpm globally: npm install -g pnpm
fullstack_course.step_9: 9. Run pnpm install to install all project dependencies
fullstack_course.step_10: 10. Test locally with pnpm dev to ensure everything works
fullstack_course.step_11: 11. Commit your changes: git commit -m 'feat: add [your-name] to fullstack course'
fullstack_course.step_12: 12. Push to your fork: git push origin add-student-[your-name]
fullstack_course.step_13: 13. Open a Pull Request on GitHub targeting the fullstack-course section
fullstack_course.no_students_yet: No students have contributed yet. Be the first!
fullstack_course.resources_description: Download PDFs, documents, and other materials for the course.
